body:
Windows API natively uses `wchar_t*`. I'd suggest you use `std::wstring` on Windows, or just call
```
  auto ret = onnxifi_load(
      ONNXIFI_LOADER_FLAG_VERSION_1_0, nullptr, suffix_cstr, &lib);
```
body_html:
Windows API natively uses wchar_t*. I'd suggest you use std::wstring on Windows, or just call

  auto ret = onnxifi_load(
      ONNXIFI_LOADER_FLAG_VERSION_1_0, nullptr, suffix_cstr, &lib);
